intro: Vincetoxicum angustilobum, commonly known as narrow-lobed false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant has opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is typically found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
